intro: Microcos schlechteri, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, sprawling stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in dense inflorescences, often appearing in late winter to early spring. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
